crossTransform.description: Compute the cross-product of two data sets.
crossTransform.title: Cross transform

___diagonal.description: If false, items along the "diagonal" of the cross-product (those elements with the same index in their respective array) will not be included in the output.

___filter.description: A string containing an expression (in JavaScript syntax) to filter the resulting data elements.

___with.description: The name of the secondary data set to cross with the primary data. If unspecified, the primary data is crossed with itself.

___groupby.description: An ordered list of fields by which to group tuples into a tree.

___field.description: The data field to impute.

___orderby.description: A list of fields to determine ordering within series.

___groupby.description: A list of fields to group the data into series.

___value.description: The value to use for missing data if the method is 'value'.

linkpathTransform.description: Computes a path definition for connecting nodes within a node-link network or tree diagram.
linkpathTransform.title: LinkPath transform

___tension.description: A tension parameter for the "tightness" of "curve"-shaped links.

___targetY.description: The data field that references the target y-coordinate for this link.

___sourceX.description: The data field that references the source x-coordinate for this link.

___targetX.description: The data field that references the target x-coordinate for this link.

___sourceY.description: The data field that references the source y-coordinate for this link.

___groupby.description: A list of fields to split the data into groups.

___field.description: The name of the field to aggregate.

___as.description: An optional array of names to use for the output fields.

$eref.description: Bins values into quantitative bins (e.g., for a histogram).
$eref.title: Bin transform

___min.description: The minimum bin value to consider.

___field.description: The name of the field to bin values from.

___div.description: An array of scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions.

___minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

___base.description: The number base to use for automatic bin determination.

___step.description: An exact step size to use between bins. If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

___max.description: The maximum bin value to consider.

___maxbins.description: The maximum number of allowable bins.

___steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

$eref.description: Compute the cross-product of two data sets.
$eref.title: Cross transform

___diagonal.description: If false, items along the "diagonal" of the cross-product (those elements with the same index in their respective array) will not be included in the output.

___filter.description: A string containing an expression (in JavaScript syntax) to filter the resulting data elements.

___with.description: The name of the secondary data set to cross with the primary data. If unspecified, the primary data is crossed with itself.

___field.description: The field containing the text to analyze.

___stopwords.description: A regexp pattern for matching stopwords to omit.

___pattern.description: A regexp pattern for matching words in text.

$eref.description: Computes a path definition for connecting nodes within a node-link network or tree diagram.
$eref.title: LinkPath transform

___tension.description: A tension parameter for the "tightness" of "curve"-shaped links.

___targetY.description: The data field that references the target y-coordinate for this link.

___sourceX.description: The data field that references the source x-coordinate for this link.

___targetX.description: The data field that references the target x-coordinate for this link.

___sourceY.description: The data field that references the source y-coordinate for this link.

$eref.description: A special aggregate transform that organizes a data set into groups or "facets".
$eref.title: Facet transform

___groupby.description: A list of fields to split the data into groups.

___field.description: The name of the field to aggregate.

___as.description: An optional array of names to use for the output fields.

$eref.description: Filters elements from a data set to remove unwanted items.
$eref.title: Filter transform

___test.description: A string containing an expression (in JavaScript syntax) for the filter predicate.

$eref.description: Collapse ("fold") one or more data properties into two properties.
$eref.title: Fold transform

oneOf.description: An array of field references indicating the data properties to fold.

$eref.description: Performs force-directed layout for network data.
$eref.title: Force transform

___friction.description: The strength of the friction force used to stabilize the layout.

___gravity.description: The strength of the pseudo-gravity force that pulls nodes towards the center of the layout area.

___linkDistance.description: Determines the length of edges, in pixels.

___links.description: The name of the link (edge) data set.

___charge.description: The strength of the charge each node exerts.

___theta.description: The theta parameter for the Barnes-Hut algorithm, which is used to compute charge forces between nodes.

___active.description: A signal representing the active node.

___iterations.description: The number of iterations to run the force directed layout.

___alpha.description: A "temperature" parameter that determines how much node positions are adjusted at each step.

___linkStrength.description: Determines the tension of edges (the spring constant).

___size.description: The dimensions [width, height] of this force layout.

___chargeDistance.description: The maximum distance over which charge forces are applied.

___fixed.description: The name of a datasource containing the IDs of nodes with fixed positions.

$eref.description: Extends data elements with new values according to a calculation formula.
$eref.title: Formula transform

___field.description: The property name in which to store the computed formula value.

___expr.description: A string containing an expression (in JavaScript syntax) for the formula.

$eref.description: Performs a cartographic projection. Given longitude and latitude values, sets corresponding x and y properties for a mark.
$eref.title: Geo transform

___projection.description: The type of cartographic projection to use.

___clipAngle.description: The clip angle of the projection.

___precision.description: The desired precision of the projection.

___clipExtent.description: The clip extent of the projection.

$eref.description: Creates paths for geographic regions, such as countries, states and counties.
$eref.title: GeoPath transform

___projection.description: The type of cartographic projection to use.

___field.description: The data field containing GeoJSON Feature data.

___clipAngle.description: The clip angle of the projection.

___precision.description: The desired precision of the projection.

___clipExtent.description: The clip extent of the projection.

___sort.description: A list of fields to use as sort criteria for sibling nodes.

___children.description: The data field for the children node array

___nodesize.description: Sets a fixed x,y size for each node (overrides the size parameter)

___field.description: The value for the area of each leaf-level node for partition layouts.

___parent.description: The data field for the parent node

___mode.description: The layout algorithm mode to use.

___size.description: The dimensions of the tree layout

___field.description: The data field to impute.

___orderby.description: A list of fields to determine ordering within series.

___groupby.description: A list of fields to group the data into series.

___value.description: The value to use for missing data if the method is 'value'.

$eref.description: Extends a data set by looking up values in another data set.
$eref.title: Lookup transform

___as.description: The names of the fields in which to store looked-up values.

___on.description: The name of the secondary data set on which to lookup values.

___onKey.description: The key field to lookup, or null for index-based lookup.

___keys.description: One or more fields in the primary data set to match against the secondary data set.

___default.description: The default value to use if a lookup match fails.

___sort.description: If true, will sort the data prior to computing angles.

___field.description: The data values to encode as angular spans. If this property is omitted, all pie slices will have equal spans.

$eref.description: Computes ascending rank scores for data tuples.
$eref.title: Rank transform

___field.description: A key field to used to rank tuples. If undefined, tuples will be ranked in their observed order.

___normalize.description: If true, values of the output field will lie in the range [0, 1].

$eref.description: Sorts the values of a data set.
$eref.title: Sort transform

___by.description: A list of fields to use as sort criteria.

$eref.description: Computes layout values for stacked graphs, as in stacked bar charts or stream graphs.
$eref.title: Stack transform

___field.description: The data field that determines the thickness/height of stacks.

___groupby.description: A list of fields to split the data into groups (stacks).

___sortby.description: A list of fields to determine the sort order of stacks.

___groupby.description: An ordered list of fields by which to group tuples into a tree.

___sort.description: A list of fields to use as sort criteria for sibling nodes.

___children.description: The data field for the children node array

___field.description: The values to use to determine the area of each leaf-level treemap cell.

___padding.description: he padding (in pixels) to provide around internal nodes in the treemap.

___parent.description: The data field for the parent node

___mode.description: The treemap layout algorithm to use.

___round.description: If true, treemap cell dimensions will be rounded to integer pixels.

___ratio.description: The target aspect ratio for the layout to optimize.

___size.description: The dimensions of the treemap layout

___sticky.description: If true, repeated runs of the treemap will use cached partition boundaries.

___clipExtent.description: The min and max points at which to clip the voronoi diagram.

___fontSize.description: The font size to use for a word.

___text.description: The field containing the text to use for each word.

___fontWeight.description: The font weight to use for a word.

___rotate.description: The field or number to set the roration angle (in degrees).

___fontStyle.description: The font style to use for a word.

___font.description: The font face to use for a word.

___size.description: The dimensions of the wordcloud layout

___spiral.description: The type of spiral used for positioning words, either 'archimedean' or 'rectangular'.

___fontScale.description: The minimum and maximum scaled font sizes, or null to prevent scaling.

___field.description: The field containing the text to analyze.

___stopwords.description: A regexp pattern for matching stopwords to omit.

___pattern.description: A regexp pattern for matching words in text.

___sort.description: A list of fields to use as sort criteria for sibling nodes.

___children.description: The data field for the children node array

___field.description: The values to use to determine the area of each leaf-level treemap cell.

___padding.description: he padding (in pixels) to provide around internal nodes in the treemap.

___parent.description: The data field for the parent node

___mode.description: The treemap layout algorithm to use.

___round.description: If true, treemap cell dimensions will be rounded to integer pixels.

___ratio.description: The target aspect ratio for the layout to optimize.

___size.description: The dimensions of the treemap layout

___sticky.description: If true, repeated runs of the treemap will use cached partition boundaries.
